doc.after: Viking Age Scandinavian settlements were set up along the southern coast of the Baltic Sea primarily for trade purposes Their appearance coincides with the settlement and consolidation of the Slavic tribes in the respective areas 39 Scandinavians had contacts to the Slavs since their very immigration these first contacts were soon followed by both the construction of Scandinavian emporia and Slavic burghs in their vicinity 40 The Scandinavian settlements were larger than the early Slavic ones their craftsmen had a considerably higher productivity and in contrast to the early Slavs the Scandinavians were capable of seafaring 40 Their importance for trade with the Slavic world however was limited to the coastal regions and their hinterlands 41
